result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Milwaukee County Clerk of Circuit Court

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Robert Wayne Maurina Jr

records.addlTxt: Defendant Robert Wayne Maurina in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed by 11/15/2022 at 5:00 pm. Case is adjourned in Branch 16.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 22, 2022 at 02:30 pm.  Jury trial scheduled for December 5, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Robert Wayne Maurina in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in Court for Scheduling Conference.  All parties appear via zoom.
Defense counsel has received discovery materials and an offer from the state, but requests additional time to review with client. Court schedules Status Conference and sets deadline of 08/10/2022 for filing of motions. Case adjourned to Br. 16.  Status conference scheduled for August 12, 2022 at 08:30 am.

22RM026717  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
05/20/22 sa

Defendant Robert Wayne Maurina in court by video, defendant in custody. Attorney Daniel Mcmurray appear in person.  Adam Joseph Best appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: Officer B. Spitzer  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 16.  Scheduling conference scheduled for July 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Court orders previous conditions to remain in full force and effect.

Defendant Robert Wayne Maurina in court with attorney Daniel Mcmurray, via zoom.  Defendant Robert Wayne Maurina in custody. Amy E Spanczak appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Return on Warrant. Arguments heard as to bail. Court sets bail at $ 250.00 with other conditions.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 10, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Bench Warrant Cleared by Milwaukee County Sheriff on 05/02/2022. Original bench warrant scanned. Case is adjourned for Return of Bench Warrant in Branch 16. Notice is given to Attorney Mcmurray and District Attorney.
Defendant/Surety's Bail Forfeiture Notice returned undeliverable.
Notice of bond forfeiture mailed to defendant. ($2,500.00 signature bond) LW
Signature bond ordered to be forfeited in the amount of 2500.00.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE JUDGE ON RETURN OF THE BENCH WARRANT.

Attorney Daniel Mcmurray in court.  Samantha Raygo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Attorney appeared by video means for .  Deputy Court Clerk: SD.
Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered a Bench Warrant to be issued REMAND TO JUDGE. Court further orders that bail is forfeited.
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 2 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.  Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription.

Defendant Robert Wayne Maurina in court with attorney Darryl Everett Smith.  Defendant Robert Wayne Maurina in custody.  Sara Waldschmidt-DeSmet appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Robert Wayne Maurina appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Grayson, Branch 16. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Motion to dismiss argued by defense and denied by the court. Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 16, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
